pull.title: Improve OpenRC initscript
pull.body:
This pull request improves the available OpenRC initscripts in
`contrib/init`.

The first commit (737feadff7c026412039774de0d10931fe0c5bcc) reworks
`checkconfig()` to not fail if **both** `rpcuser` and `rpcpassword`
are unset, because this implies that bitcoind shall use the `.cookie`
file for RPC authentication. Currently, the initscript does not allow
starting bitcoind without a set `rpcuser` and `rpcpassword`.

The second commit (95f97111dd27f32dfcb461c9dd6890aa8d1355ed) simply
quotes some unquoted variables.

verification.payload:
tree 4a616d492184df4cb19661b73af80ddb54978cd8
parent b401b093556f53023d1615f7cff3eb84807c6e8b
author parazyd <parazyd@dyne.org> 1612780036 +0100
committer parazyd <parazyd@dyne.org> 1612998582 +0100

contrib/init: (OpenRC) Do not fail if both rpcuser and rpcpassword are unset.

This implies the .cookie file shall be used for RPC and having _both_ unset
in bitcoin.conf should allow bitcoind to start.

events.message:
contrib/init: (OpenRC) Do not fail if both rpcuser and rpcpassword are unset.

This implies the .cookie file shall be used for RPC and having _both_ unset
in bitcoin.conf should allow bitcoind to start.

verification.payload:
tree a2c610517e3ba7b0759a14d1d45c4ed07f775189
parent 737feadff7c026412039774de0d10931fe0c5bcc
author parazyd <parazyd@dyne.org> 1612780180 +0100
committer parazyd <parazyd@dyne.org> 1612998582 +0100

contrib/init: (OpenRC) quote some unquoted variables.

events.body: Updated. Thank you for the review.
LGTM! Changes are simple and I have actually tested them.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -60,16 +60,18 @@ start_pre() {
 	"${BITCOIND_PIDDIR}"
 
 	checkpath -f \
-	-o ${BITCOIND_USER}:${BITCOIND_GROUP} \
+	-o "${BITCOIND_USER}:${BITCOIND_GROUP}" \
 	-m 0660 \
-	${BITCOIND_CONFIGFILE}
+	"${BITCOIND_CONFIGFILE}"
 
 	checkconfig || return 1
 }
 
 checkconfig()
 {
-	if ! grep -qs '^rpcpassword=' "${BITCOIND_CONFIGFILE}" ; then
+

@@ -89,4 +91,15 @@ checkconfig()
 		eerror ""
 		return 1
 	fi
+
+	if ! grep -qs '^alertnotify=' "${BITCOIND_CONFIGFILE}" ; then
+		ewarn ""
+		ewarn "It is recommended that you set alertnotify in your bitcoin.conf"
+		ewarn "so you are notified of problems:"
+		ewarn ""
+		ewarn "ie: alertnotify=echo %%s | mail -s \"Bitcoin Alert\"" \
+			"admin@foo.com"
+		ewarn ""
+		return 0
+	fi

@@ -89,4 +91,15 @@ checkconfig()
 		eerror ""
 		return 1
 	fi
+
+	if ! grep -qs '^alertnotify=' "${BITCOIND_CONFIGFILE}" ; then
+		ewarn ""
+		ewarn "It is recommended that you set alertnotify in your bitcoin.conf"
+		ewarn "so you are notified of problems:"
+		ewarn ""
+		ewarn "ie: alertnotify=echo %%s | mail -s \"Bitcoin Alert\"" \
+			"admin@foo.com"
+		ewarn ""
+		return 0
+	fi
comments.body: I wanted to keep it since the existing script was also notifying about it. Do you think this part should be removed?
